connections.description: The stream of the Almo likely lies about one Roman mile from the Porta Capena itself. The stream may have marked the limit of Regio I to the south.

connections.title: Regio I (Porta Capena)

description: A small river of the Ager Romanus that once joined the Tiber River just below the walls of Rome. Almo, the eldest son of Tyrrhus, who is one of the heroes in Virgil's Aeneid, shares the river's name.

history.comment: Changed reference types to "Evidence" for primary sources
